After meeting with Brazilian Energy Minister Bento Albuquerque, Puri said that Indian companies will also be looking at boosting investment in Brazil. Albuquerque said Brazil is willing to meet India's increased demand for oil.

175.title: Will co-create defence, aerospace tech: Adani after meeting UK PM
175.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani on Thursday said the Adani Group will work with companies from the UK to "co-create defence and aerospace technologies" as part of the Indian government's Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. This comes after Adani met with UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat. Johnson and Adani focused their discussions on key issues like energy transition and climate action.

176.title: Admissions to PG courses will soon be done through CUET: UGC Chairman
176.article_body: Admissions to postgraduate courses will soon be conducted through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), M Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman of the University Grants Commission said on Thursday. "We are internally discussing conducting CUET twice a year so that the students who could not appear for it the first time can do so in the second chance," he said.

177.title: Woman booked for trying to extort ₹5 crore from Maha Minister
177.article_body: An FIR was registered against a woman who allegedly tried to extort ₹5 crore from Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde. Police officials said that the woman called him from international mobile numbers, demanding a shop and an expensive mobile phone. She threatened to defame him on social media if he did not accept her demands, the police added.

178.title: Over 20 cr unused COVID-19 vaccines available with States, UTs: Centre
178.article_body: Over 20.16 crore balance and unutilised COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with states and Union Territories (UTs) to be administered, informed the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in its official statement on Thursday. The Union Government is committed to accelerating the pace and expanding the scope of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country, said the Ministry.

179.title: Man Utd would be battling relegation without Ronaldo: Piers Morgan
179.article_body: Reacting to Manchester United's 0-4 loss against Liverpool, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "United would be facing a relegation battle without Cristiano Ronaldo this season in the Premier League." "Abysmal performance," added Morgan in his tweet. Ronaldo has scored 15 goals in 26 Premier League games so far this season. Manchester United are currently sixth on the points table.

180.title: 2 sisters, tortured by dad, rescued from child marriage bid in Indore
180.article_body: Authorities in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district rescued two sisters, aged 15 and 17, who were allegedly being forced to get married, an official said on Thursday. The girls were being compelled to marry two youths from Dewas district, official added. The girls also alleged that their father often tortured them in an inebriated state and had tried to kill them.

181.title: Indians can now use BHIM UPI to make payments in UAE
181.article_body: BHIM UPI is now live at NeoPay terminals across the UAE and can be used by Indian tourists to pay for their purchases at shops and merchant stores, the international arm of NPCI announced. The partnership between NPCI International Payments Ltd and NeoPay was announced last year. Notably, Indians can already use UPI in countries like Bhutan and Singapore.

182.title: We will name Shivamogga airport after BS Yediyurappa: K'taka CM
182.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai announced that the under-construction airport in Shivamogga, Karnataka, will be named after former state CM BS Yediyurappa. He said that the state government has taken a decision in this regard and will send the proposal to civil aviation ministry. "It would give a big boost for education, health services and industrialisation of Shivamogga," Bommai added.

183.title: ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in Gurugram, 3 other Haryana districts: CM
183.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said a fine of ₹500 will be imposed for not wearing face masks in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the state. He said authorities in these four districts have been directed to keep a vigil on COVID-19 situation. The state had earlier lifted the mandate of wearing masks on April 2.

184.title: We intend to deliver more weapons: Danish PM on visit to Kyiv
184.article_body: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen on Thursday pledged to deliver more weapons to Ukraine after visiting the capital Kyiv with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez. Frederiksen and Sanchez are in Kyiv to meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a gesture of support. "We intend to deliver more weapons to Ukraine because that is what is most needed," Frederiksen said.

185.title: Sainz signs 2-year contract extension to remain at Ferrari until 2024
185.article_body: Carlos Sainz has signed a new two-year contract keeping him at Ferrari until the end of 2024. "I have always said that there is no better Formula One team to race for and after over a year with them, I can confirm that putting on this race suit and representing this team is unique and incomparable," Sainz said.

186.title: India criticises US politician, says 'She visited part of J&K illegally occupied by Pak'
186.article_body: India's External Affairs Ministry criticised US Congresswoman Ilhan Omar, who was on a visit to Pakistan, saying, "She has visited a part of...J&K that's currently illegally occupied by Pakistan." Calling it condemnable, MEA said, "If such a politician wishes to practise her narrow-minded politics at home that may be her business, but violating our territorial integrity...makes this ours."

187.title: Was in shock, there was too much blood: Malaika on her car accident
187.article_body: Malaika Arora, in a recent interview, opened up about her car accident that took place at the Mumbai-Pune expressway earlier this month. "Physically, I am recovering, but mentally, I feel that it doesn't go away completely," she stated. Describing her accident, Malaika said, "I was in shock...I wanted to know...whether I was alive or not. There was too much blood."

188.title: Mumbai man stopped from kissing woman, spits on policeman
188.article_body: A 27-year-old man from Mumbai was booked after he allegedly manhandled and spat on a police constable, who confronted him for kissing and hugging a woman at Vasai railway station. "He abused and threatened me and spat on my face twice and caught my collar," the constable said in his complaint. The accused is not arrested yet, the police added.

189.title: Hyd constable harasses, extorts ₹30,000 from 2 people, dismissed
189.article_body: A constable in Hyderabad, Akash Bhatt was dismissed from service for harassing and extorting ₹30,000 from two people. While patrolling on April 15, the constable spotted two people and demanded ₹15,000 and let them go after taking their phone numbers, reports said. Bhatt, however, continued to harass them over the phone and took another ₹15,000.

190.title: Sir David Attenborough named ‘Champion of the Earth’ by UN
190.article_body: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) has presented Sir David Attenborough with the Champions of the Earth Lifetime Achievement Award.  The award recognizes Attenborough's "outsized impact on the global environmental movement". "We know what the problems are and we know how to solve them. What we lack is unified action," the 95-year-old naturalist said.

191.title: Govt to decide LIC IPO timing within this week: Official
191.article_body: The government would decide the timing of LIC IPO, initially planned for in March, within this week, a senior official told PTI. It'd be tough to decide whether to go ahead with the retail and domestic investor demand or wait for FIIs, the official added. Notably, if the IPO is not launched by May 12, it'd be deferred till August-September.

192.title: Wisden unveils its 10 best cricket images of 2021
192.article_body: Wisden has unveiled its 10 best cricket images of 2021. An image of England's Jos Buttler jumping over Australia's Steve Smith during England's win against eventual champions Australia at T20 World Cup 2021 has been named Wisden Photograph of 2021. The top 10 images include photographs of Jasprit Bumrah warming up and Joe Root expressing disappointment on dismissal, among others.

193.title: What are the features of the world's 'most powerful missile' tested by Russia?
193.article_body: Russia has successfully tested the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile, which Russia's Defence Ministry called the world's "most powerful missile". It weighs more than 200 tonnes and is able to transport multiple warheads. As per Russian media, Sarmat is a three-stage, liquid-fueled missile with a range of 18,000 km. It has been designed to elude anti-missile defence systems.

194.title: Reports of my husband being gay are so silly: Hugh Jackman's wife
194.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman's wife Deborra-Lee Furness has denied the reports that Hugh is a gay man still in the closet. "It's so silly...It just amazes me that these magazines continue to get away with it," Furness added. "If he was gay, he could be gay. He didn't have to hide in the closet anymore," the Australian actress further said.

195.title: 9 bodies found outside Kyiv, some show signs of torture: Ukraine
195.article_body: Andriy Niebytov, the police chief in Ukraine's Kyiv region, has said the bodies of nine civilians have been found in the town of Borodyanka. He said, "These people were killed by the occupiers and some show signs of torture. The Russian military knowingly shot civilians who didn't put up any resistance." Niebytov added police had discovered two graves around Borodyanka.

196.title: No oil spills on Gultekdi flyover, beware of rumours: PMC to people
196.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has refuted claims of oil spills causing accidents on city's Gultekdi flyover, terming the reports as "fake". Taking to Twitter, PMC stated that a fire brigade vehicle had been sent to location, which found no oil spills in the area. "We request citizens to not believe in any rumours being spread on social media," PMC tweeted.

197.title: Abhishek Bachchan is very humble & supportive: 'Dasvi' co-star Arun
197.article_body: 'Dasvi' actor Arun Kushwah, speaking about his film's co-star Abhishek Bachchan, has said, "Abhishek sir is a great company, very humble and supportive." Arun further stated that he and Abhishek never had a boring moment together. "I also believe that you get to learn a lot when you work with experienced individuals," he added. The film also featured Yami Gautam.

198.title: UK PM climbs onto a bulldozer at JCB factory in Gujarat; video surfaces
198.article_body: A video showing UK PM Boris Johnson climbing onto a bulldozer at JCB's new factory and waving during his visit to Gujarat's Panchmahal has surfaced online. Johnson was visiting the factory with Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel on Thursday. He also met business tycoon Gautam Adani, who tweeted, "Honoured to host Boris Johnson, the first UK PM to visit Gujarat."

199.title: India's richest person Adani hosts UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat; shares pic
199.article_body: Gautam Adani, India's richest person and the world's sixth-richest person with $117 billion wealth, hosted UK's PM Boris Johnson on Thursday at the Adani Group headquarters in Gujarat. Johnson, who's on a two-day visit to India, is the first UK PM to visit Gujarat. Adani tweeted that he was "honoured" to host the UK PM.

200.title: No taboos for us: Germany's Baerbock on providing weapons to Ukraine
200.article_body: Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said there are "no taboos" in Germany supplying armoured vehicles and weapons to Ukraine as Russia's invasion of the country continues. She added that Germany's priority was to quickly provide Ukraine with Soviet-designed kit that its military could use without requiring any extra training. "We know that everyday counts," Baerbock said.

201.title: Adani JV among 14 firms chosen under ₹120 crore-drone PLI scheme
201.article_body: Fourteen drone companies, including Adani's joint venture company with Israel's Elbit, and ideaForge Technology, have been selected as beneficiaries of a production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme, the Aviation Ministry stated. The PLI, worth ₹120 crore, is aimed at boosting drone manufacturing in India. The firms will be given 20% of the "value addition" made by them in the next three years.

202.title: Odisha Dalit man forced to rub nose in spit for refusing ₹500 temple donation
202.article_body: A 32-year-old Dalit man was allegedly forced to rub his nose in his own spit for refusing to donate ₹500 for a temple renovation work in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said. His wife alleged that the village sarpanch abused the couple for refusing to give the donation. The sarpanch, who dismissed the allegations, has been booked along with three others.

203.title: NTPC to use Delhi's sludge to produce environment-friendly energy
203.article_body: National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) will use the sludge produced in Delhi Jal Board's sewage treatment plants (STPs) to produce energy in an environment-friendly manner, a statement said. Using sludge to produce energy will reduce net carbon dioxide emissions and control water and land pollution, the statement added. NTPC aims to produce 60GW of energy through renewable sources by 2032.

204.title: Chinese Defence Minister warns US, says 'don't underestimate China'
204.article_body: Chinese National Defence Minister Wei Fenghe held a telephonic conversation with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and exchanged views on issues like maritime and air security and the Ukraine situation. During the conversation, Wei reportedly warned the US "not to underestimate China's determination and capability". China hopes to establish stable major-country relations with the US, he added.

205.title: Russia has warned Mariupol residents to wear white ribbon or get shot: Ukraine
205.article_body: The Russian forces in the besieged city of Mariupol, Ukraine, have threatened to shoot civilians if they don't wear white ribbons, Petro Andriushchenko, advisor to the Mayor of Mariupol, said. The white ribbon is believed to be a symbol for Russian troops to identify Ukrainians who've accepted defeat. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday claimed to have "successfully liberated" Mariupol.

206.title: WhatsApp planning paid multi-device support for businesses: Report
206.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a paid subscription plan for WhatsApp Business, which will allow users to connect up to 10 devices to a single WhatsApp account, WaBetaInfo reported. This will allow multiple employees to access the same account on their phones. Currently, users can connect four additional devices for free, both on WhatsApp and WhatsApp Business.

207.title: Man with degree to check specs number treats UP woman, she goes blind
207.article_body: A woman was rendered blind after a man, Kuldeep, who has degree only for checking number of glasses worn by people, treated her at a "fake eye clinic". The victim, Prema Devi, had visited Kuldeep's clinic on April 5. Kuldeep had given her some eye-drops. Her son said that his mother lost her eyesight three days after receiving the medicine.

208.title: Pay ₹2,000 fine for taking selfies on railway tracks: Southern Railway
208.article_body: Chennai division of Southern Railway will levy a fine of ₹2,000 on individuals caught taking selfies on railway tracks or near locomotives. Additionally, people caught travelling on footboards will be punished with either a prison term of up to three months or a ₹500 fine. The move comes weeks after an accident on railway tracks in Chengalpattu claimed three lives.

209.title: Will follow SC order on Jahangirpuri but drive to continue: NDMC Mayor
209.article_body: The North Delhi Municipal Corporation will follow the Supreme Court's order and not conduct the anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri, the civic body's Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh said on Thursday. "I also want to clarify that the civic body will keep taking action against encroachers. We will identify illegal encroachments and send notices to them and take action," Singh said.

210.title: CSK's Chris Jordan has conceded runs as if they were on sale: Harbhajan
210.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the performances of CSK pacer Chris Jordan who conceded 58 runs in the franchise's last IPL 2022 match against GT, Harbhajan Singh said Jordan has conceded runs as if they were "on sale". "Jordan needs to sit back and think about his own game," added Harbhajan. CSK will take on MI today.

211.title: AAP politicising police: Sidhu after Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas
211.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said the AAP government is politicising the police force to use it for their own interests and to target those who raise their voice against AAP's Arvind Kejriwal. This comes after Punjab Police booked Kumar Vishwas over "inflammatory statements" against Kejriwal. "Punjab's CM has become a 'rubber da gudda' (rubber doll)," Sidhu added.

212.title: Filled with pride for my powerhouse bhaijaan: Ishaan praises Shahid for Jersey
212.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter took to Instagram to praise actor Shahid Kapoor for his recently released film 'Jersey'. Sharing his review for the movie, Ishaan wrote, "As a brother, I'm filled with pride, as an actor with respect and as an audience with admiration for my powerhouse bhaijaan @ShahidKapoor. Thank you for sharing what you did through this character."

213.title: German Finance Minister tests positive for COVID-19 during US trip
213.article_body: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said he tested positive for COVID-19 after his appointments with the International Monetary Fund and the G20 in Washington. Lindner added that due to having taken three vaccinations he was experiencing "only mild and already fading cold symptoms". Lindner, 43, had more appointments scheduled on Thursday in the US before returning to Germany.

214.title: I am not sure how relevant MI-CSK rivalry is in IPL 2022: Harbhajan
214.article_body: Discussing the upcoming match between MI and CSK, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said he is not sure how "relevant" their rivalry is in IPL 2022. "The franchises that were in the top two are now in bottom two," added Harbhajan. "This match was like India versus Pakistan in terms of rivalry," stated Harbhajan. Harbhajan represented both franchises during his career.

215.title: Mumbai's Khar subway to remain closed for repair works till May 2
215.article_body: The Khar Golibar subway will remain closed between 10:00 pm and 5:00 am till May 2 for urgent repair works. The subway will be closed for vehicular traffic and pedestrians coming from Vakola Junction, Santacruz station and Golibar road towards Santacruz West, the Western Railway said. Vehicles will be diverted from Agripada slip road to Milan Subway.

216.title: 2 farmers killed, 1 injured after being attacked by wild bear in Jharkhand
216.article_body: Two farmers died while another suffered serious injuries when a wild bear attacked them in Jharkhand's Gumla district on Thursday. According to police, the farmers were ploughing their paddy field at Ambera Nagesiatoli village when an adult wild bear attacked them. While 56-year-old Lalit Kishan died on the spot, Subhash Kishan and Mangleshwar Kishan sustained injuries, police added.

217.title: Still can't believe you're gone: Actress Akshara Gowda on her mother's demise
217.article_body: Actress Akshara Gowda mourned the loss of her mother who passed away on April 12. Taking to Instagram, she shared a post for her and wrote, "The worst part about the death of someone you love is...you can't die with them (I so wish I can)...I still can't believe you are gone...I hope I'll make you proud."

218.title: Amid threats, Dalit bridegroom rides a horse under police protection in MP
218.article_body: Amid threats, a Dalit bridegroom rode a horse for his marriage ritual under police protection in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district. He was allegedly threatened by the upper-caste villagers with consequences if he did so, police said. Eleven people were also put under preventive arrest, police added. The 22-year-old groom had posted a video seeking help on social media.

219.title: Fire breaks out in building in Mumbai's Khar; 8 fire tenders douse blaze
219.article_body: A level-2 fire broke out on the fourth floor of the seven-storey Notan Villa building in Mumbai's Khar on Thursday morning, a civic official said. At least eight fire engines, water tankers, ambulances and other fire-fighting equipment reached the spot and four people were rescued from the building's terrace, officials said. The fire has now been doused.

220.title: US' Arizona wildfire gets 3 times bigger, thousands forced to evacuate
220.article_body: A wildfire in US' Arizona, dubbed as Tunnel Fire, is said to have grown three times in size as it spread over thousands of acres, burning down dozens of structures. Thousands of residents were forced to leave their homes in the affected areas. The fire swept largely unpopulated hills and valleys about 23 km north of Flagstaff, said the authorities.

221.title: At least 10 people test positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras
221.article_body: At least 10 people have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras, officials said on Thursday. This comes amid spike in COVID-19 cases in several parts of India. Tamil Nadu, on Wednesday reported 31 new COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, India saw 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 COVID-19 induced deaths in last 24 hours. Active cases in India stand at 13,433.

222.title: Man cooks & eats body parts of his neighbour; declared fit for trial in US
222.article_body: A 40-year-old man who allegedly cooked and ate his neighbour's body parts after killing him last year has been declared sane and fit for trial by psychiatrists in US' Idaho. The accused was involuntarily committed to the Idaho Security Medical Program in October. He will be presented in a magistrate court on Friday, according to reports.

223.title: Wisden names its 5 cricketers of the year, 2 Indians included
223.article_body: Wisden named its five cricketers of the year in the 2022 edition of the Wisden Almanack. The 'Wisden Cricketers of the Year' are India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, India captain Rohit Sharma, New Zealand batter Devon Conway, England fast bowler Ollie Robinson and South Africa Women captain Dane van Niekerk. Meanwhile, Wisden named Joe Root as 'Leading Cricketer of the Year'.

224.title: Ronaldo shares video of fans' gesture after newborn's death, says 'Will never forget this'
224.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo shared a video on Instagram showing football fans' gesture for him during Manchester United-Liverpool match at Anfield following the death of his newborn son. A fan-led minute's applause was held in the seventh minute as a tribute to Ronaldo's family. "Me and my family will never forget this moment of respect and compassion," Ronaldo wrote.

225.title: There needs to be some sense in their batting: Wasim Jaffer on PBKS
225.article_body: Talking about PBKS, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said, "You 'live by the sword, die by the sword', but they are dying more than living. There needs to be some sense in their batting performance." PBKS were bowled out for 115 against DC which is the lowest total in IPL 2022 so far. DC defeated PBKS by nine wickets.

226.title: British fighters captured in Ukraine being fed, looked after: Russia
226.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry said Moscow is "taking care" of British fighters who had been captured in Ukraine. "They are fed, watered, and given...necessary assistance. Just like other foreigners who've surrendered or been detained," it added. On Monday, the fighters appeared on Russian state TV and asked to be exchanged for Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Viktor Medvedchuk, held in Ukraine.

227.title: Russia has taken control of 80% of Ukraine’s Luhansk region: Guv
227.article_body: Russia has taken control of 80% of Ukraine's Luhansk region, Governor Serhiy Haidai has said. He said that having captured Kreminna, the Russians are threatening Rubizhne and Popasna cities. Haidai asked the residents in the region to evacuate immediately. Before the war began, the Ukrainian government reportedly controlled 60% of the region.

228.title: CSK's Adam Milne ruled out of IPL 2022, SL's Matheesha Pathirana to replace him
228.article_body: CSK pacer Adam Milne has been ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a hamstring injury, which he suffered in their first game of the season against KKR. Sri Lanka's 19-year-old pacer Matheesha Pathirana, who played the Under-19 World Cup 2022, has been named as his replacement. Pathirana had picked seven wickets in four games in the World Cup.

229.title: Not one drop of water will flow out of Punjab to other states: Cheema
229.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that not even a single drop of the state's water will be allowed to flow out to any other state. His response came a day after AAP MP Sushil Gupta promised Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water to every village in Haryana if the party comes to power there.

230.title: 50-year-old woman, 2 sons found dead at brick kiln in Jharkhand
230.article_body: A 50-year-old woman and her two sons were found dead on Wednesday at a brick kiln in Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, police said. They went home along with other workers after it was lit at around 10 pm on Tuesday, police said. However, they returned to look after the brick kiln at 1 am following rainfall in the area.

231.title: I don't take my phones to meetings to avoid being spied on: EU tech chief
231.article_body: The EU's technology chief Margrethe Vestager advised not to take phones to important meetings to avoid digital espionage. "I'd leave my phones and my iPad outside of the room before entering," she said. "Most of my feed is so boring that even if you had access to it, you'd think oh my God, this woman...she has no life," she added.

232.title: Pant was the one who made Avesh Khan, now he's making Kuldeep: Kaif
232.article_body: Discussing DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav's performances in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said, "[DC captain] Rishabh Pant was the one who made [pacer] Avesh Khan and [now he] is making Kuldeep." "Kuldeep has been told to go after the wickets, generally captains ask the bowlers to bowl tightly," added Kaif. Kuldeep has taken 13 wickets so far.

233.title: Commander of Russian sapper regiment killed in Ukraine: Reports
233.article_body: The commander of a Russian sapper regiment has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Colonel Mikhail Nagamov, commander of the sixth engineer- sapper regiment of the Western Military District, was killed in Ukraine on April 13 "while performing a combat mission in Ukraine". At least eight generals and 35 colonels have died in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24.

234.title: Hyderabad sees hottest day of year with max temperature at 40.6°C
234.article_body: Amid rising temperatures, Hyderabad reported the season's highest temperature on Thursday with a maximum temperature of 40.6 degrees Celsius. The Meteorological Centre, Hyderabad, said, "The temperature in the city has been recorded at 40.6 degrees Celsius, it's the highest day temperature recorded in the year." Meanwhile, officials have urged people to avoid going to the sun between 12 pm-3 pm.

235.title: Hyd Police issues advisory to people as maximum temperature reaches 40°C
235.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday issued an advisory to people as the maximum temperature rose to 40°C. It asked people to drink plenty of water, never leave children, adults or pets in the car, keep cool, schedule activities and help others. The maximum and minimum temperatures in the city are likely to settle at around 40°C and 26°C respectively.

236.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths fall for another week: WHO
236.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said COVID-19 cases and deaths reported globally fell last week, continuing a decline since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 11 to 17 over five million cases and over 18,000 deaths were reported globally, a 24% and 12% decrease respectively compared to the previous week.

237.title: Need to integrate Ayurveda, Yoga with modern medical practices: Health Min
237.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said there is a need to integrate indigenous medical systems like Ayurveda and Yoga with modern medical practices. This will help in providing holistic healthcare solutions to people, he said. Mandaviya added that while Ayurveda is effective in preventive healthcare, modern medicines, on the other hand, play key role in diagnosis and treatment.

238.title: PM Modi urges district officials to draw plans to implement govt schemes
238.article_body: On the occasion of 'Civil Services Day', PM Narendra Modi urged district officials to draw action plans to implement government schemes on ground. He asked civil servants to select any one scheme of the Central government and implement it in their districts. "Speak to former officers who served the district you are...deployed in and take their counsel," he added.

239.title: Amber admits to hitting Depp in recording of their fight, says 'You're a baby, grow up'
239.article_body: Amber Heard could be heard admitting to hitting Johnny Depp in a recording played in court. "I didn't punch you. I'm sorry I didn't hit you across the face in a proper slap, but I was hitting you, it was not punching you," she could be heard saying. "You are such a baby, grow the f**k up, Johnny," she said.

240.title: Death penalty of man who raped, killed 4-yr-old in MP commuted
240.article_body: The Supreme Court has commuted the death sentence of a man, who had raped and murdered a four-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh in 2013, to 20-year imprisonment. The bench refused to sentence convict Mohd Firoz to imprisonment for the rest of his life, saying, "Every saint has a past and every sinner has a future."

241.title: Arjun undergoes pyshical transformation for 'Made in Heaven 2'; shares post
241.article_body: Actor Arjun Mathur underwent a physical transformation for his upcoming show 'Made in Heaven' season 2. When asked about it, he said, "I had a transformative experience while turning into Karan Mehra under the expert guidance of Samir Jaura." "He knows just how hard he needs to push for you to achieve a goal," he added.

242.title: Prashant Kishor wants to join the party without any preconditions: Cong Gen Secy
242.article_body: Congress General Secretary Tariq Anwar said that Prashant Kishor is willing to join the party without any preconditions and his induction would certainly help the party. He further said that Sonia Gandhi wants to take senior leaders into confidence and seek their opinion on Kishor's entry into the party. "Kishor is a brand and he has proven that," Anwar added.

243.title: Manchester United appoint Erik ten Hag as manager on 3-year deal
243.article_body: Manchester United on Thursday confirmed the appointment of Erik ten Hag as the club's new manager. The 52-year-old's tenure will begin from the end of the current season and go on till June 2025, the club announced. Erik ten Hag is currently the head coach Dutch club Ajax. He won Dutch Eredivisie with the club in 2018-19 and 2020-21.

244.title: Viral pic shows Class 10 students drinking beer in school hostel in Telangana
244.article_body: A picture showing Class 10 students of a government-run school in Telangana's Mancherial drinking beer in their hostel has gone viral on social media. Preliminary investigation by school authorities revealed that the students were celebrating a farewell party on the night of April 17. While an enquiry has been ordered, an officer said the hostel warden failed in his duties.

245.title: Tesla reports $3.32 bn profit in Q1, 658% rise year-on-year
245.article_body: Tesla has reported a $3.32 billion profit in the first quarter of 2022, a 658% increase from the $438 million reported in the same period last year. Its revenue for the quarter stood at  $18.76 billion, beating estimates of $17.85 billion. Tesla's revenue saw an 81% increase year-over-year, compared to $10.4 billion in revenue in Q1 2021.

246.title: Overwhelmed and grateful: Sanjay on fans cheering for him in cricket stadium
246.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a video of his fans cheering for him when he visited a cricket stadium to support the IPL team Royal Challengers Bangalore. Dutt also posted a picture with actress Raveena Tandon from the stadium. He was seen sporting a T-shirt with name Adheera, which is his character's name in 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

247.title: 4 ivory artefacts seized by wildlife bureau in West Bengal, 1 held
247.article_body: Four ivory artefacts were seized at Kharsarai in West Bengal’s Hooghly on Wednesday. The seizure was made during a joint raid by officers of the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB) of the Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the state forest department, officials said. “One person was arrested...The suspect wanted to sell the statues,” an official said.

248.title: Chinese national gets 20 yrs in jail in Rwanda for beating local man
248.article_body: A Chinese national has been sentenced to 20 years in prison by a Rwandan court for beating up a local man there last year. The accused, Sun Shujun, operated a mine in Rutsiro district and was purportedly filmed beating a man who was tied to a pole. A Rwandan man was also handed prison term for alleged role in crime.

249.title: I think he has much more to give to WI: Narine on Pollard's retirement
249.article_body: Reacting to WI limited-overs captain Kieron Pollard announcing his retirement from international cricket, WI spinner Sunil Narine said, "It's sad, I think he has much more to give to WI." Narine added, "They love to see him play in WI, but he knows best. I think he is going to focus more on T20 cricket around the world."

250.title: Punjab Army man cheated of ₹10 lakh on pretext of sending kin to Canada
250.article_body: A subedar with the Indian Army was allegedly cheated of ₹10 lakh by an ex-serviceman in Punjab on the pretext of sending his wife and son to Canada for jobs. The victim, a resident of Punjab’s Hoshiarpur, is posted in Bikaner, Rajasthan. The victim has posted videos on social media urging the Punjab CM and other ministers to take action.

251.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru; MDMA crystals worth ₹70 lakh seized
251.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have arrested a Nigerian drug peddler, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said in a tweet on Thursday. Police have also recovered 800 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth around ₹70 lakh, from his possession. Further, a mobile phone and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

252.title: A$AP Rocky released from jail after posting ₹4.2 cr bail bond: Report
252.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky who was recently arrested at the Los Angeles International Airport in connection with November 2021 shooting has reportedly been released after paying a bail amount of $550,000 (₹4.19 crore). According to the police, Rocky is accused of firing a handgun at a person on November 6, 2021, following an argument. The victim had suffered a minor injury.

253.title: I was pumped to try it: Ayushmann on portraying an undercover cop in Anek
253.article_body: Speaking about his character in his upcoming film 'Anek', Ayushmann Khurrana said, "[It's] the first time...audience will see me in this avatar. I've played a cop before but this is the first time they'll see me going undercover." "I was...pumped to try my hands at portraying 'Joshua' as it gave me...opportunity to explore something I hadn't done before," he added.

254.title: 3 kids accused of rape & theft flee protection home in Muzaffarnagar
254.article_body: Three children escaped from a government protection home in the Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. Two among them have been involved in a theft case, while the third kid was booked for rape. The assistant superintendent of the protection home along with three guards have also been booked in connection with the case.

255.title: Minorities commission to submit report on Jahangirpuri violence
255.article_body: National Commission for Minorities member Syed Shahezadi said the panel will submit a report to the Centre on communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. "If there's anything which warrants action, then we will surely recommend action," Shahezadi said. Referring to US-based Genocide Watch's report claiming "genocide" of Muslims could take place in India, she said, "Foreigners are totally wrong."

256.title: Man held with ₹30 lakh gold hidden under wig at Delhi airport, video surfaces
256.article_body: A man has been arrested at the Delhi airport for allegedly smuggling 686 grams of gold worth around ₹30 lakh by concealing it inside a wig and in rectum. A video shows customs officials at the airport removing his wig. The passenger arrived at the Delhi airport from Abu Dhabi on Monday, official said.

257.title: SUV driver allegedly runs over stray dog in Bengaluru; booked
257.article_body: Police have booked an SUV driver for allegedly running over and killing a stray dog in Bengaluru's Nagadevanahalli area. The incident reportedly took place when the dog was crossing a road in the city. A Bengaluru-based software engineer and activist, Ramachandra Bhat, registered a case over the incident, following which police booked the driver and launched a hunt for him.

258.title: Roadside bomb blast in Kabul injures 2 children
258.article_body: A roadside bomb blast in Afghanistan's capital Kabul has wounded at least two children on Thursday, a police official said. No group has claimed responsibility for the explosion so far. This comes two days after multiple explosions targeting educational institutions in Kabul killed at least six people, mostly children, and injured 17 others.

259.title: 4 lakh students shifted from private to govt schools in Delhi this year: Kejriwal
259.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during his Karnataka visit said that government schools in the national capital are better than private schools and four lakh students shifted from private to government schools in Delhi this year. Praising the work done by his government, Kejriwal said, "Delhi government has been successful in providing best medical treatment to two crore people for free."

260.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA vacates Champawat seat for CM Dhami
260.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Gahtori, who won the election from the Champawat Assembly seat, resigned as MLA to make way for CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. "The resignation of MLA Kailash Gahtori has been accepted. The Chief Minister will now contest from this seat," said BJP state chief Madan Kaushik. Notably, Dhami had lost election from Khatima to Congress' Bhuwan Chandra Kapri.

261.title: PM Modi lauds entrepreneurs, says India saw 14 unicorns in Q1 2022
261.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said India saw 14 unicorn startups in the first quarter of 2022. He praised the efforts of young entrepreneurs while adding that during the last eight years, many big changes have been implemented in the country which have "behavioural change" at their core. He made the comments while addressing bureaucrats on 15th Civil Services Day.

262.title: Don't be a pawn: Taiwan to Solomon Islands on China security pact
262.article_body: Taiwan on Wednesday warned Solomon Islands against being used as a 'pawn' after latter signed a security pact with China earlier this week. "[The]...deal...could destabilise regional peace and security," Taiwanese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Joanne Ou said. Her remarks come amid concerns by US, Australia and New Zealand that the deal could lead to Chinese military expansionism in Pacific region.

263.title: Haha okey bhai: Kuldeep Yadav to troll asking him to focus on cricket
263.article_body: A troll asked DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav to focus on cricket after he posted a tweet on Premier League club Manchester United amid their match against Liverpool. Responding to the troll, Kuldeep wrote, "Haha okey bhai." Kuldeep is currently the second highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 13 scalps.

264.title: Players lie down on ground as bee attack halts training session, MI share video
264.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) have shared a video showing a bee attack halting their training session. In the video, players can be seen lying down on the ground to protect themselves. "To bee or not to bee in training was a question yesterday!" MI wrote alongside the video. MI are scheduled to face CSK in IPL 2022 tonight.

265.title: Musk confirms Tesla is working on robotaxi with no steering wheel or pedals
265.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while presenting the company's Q1 2022 financial results, confirmed that Tesla is working on a robotaxi. "We're working on a new vehicle...which is a dedicated robotaxi that's highly optimised for autonomy, meaning it would not have [a] steering wheel or pedals," said Musk. "We aspire to reach volume production of that in 2024," added Musk.

266.title: Inshallah got shelved because of Salman & Bhansali's creative differences: Producer
266.article_body: Film producer Jayantilal Gada spoke about Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film 'Inshallah', which was supposed to star actors Salman Khan and Alia Bhatt. Jayantilal said, "We had started work on that film. However...Bhansali and Salman...had some creative differences. I don't know exactly as we don't get into such matters." "So, [Inshallah] got shelved and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' went on floors," he added.

267.title: Omicron can increase risk of respiratory disorder in children: Study
267.article_body: According to study, the Omicron variant of the coronavirus can increase the risk of upper airway infection (UAI) among children. This puts them at higher risk of heart attack and other severe complications. Researchers analysed that amid the Omicron surge, cases of UAI increased. As young children have small and relatively collapsible airways, they are vulnerable to UAI, they added.

268.title: I was doing elaichi: Ajay Devgn after being criticised for ad
268.article_body: Ajay Devgn was asked about actors facing criticism for the products they choose to endorse. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be...I'd say it without naming it because I don't want to promote it; I was doing elaichi," he stated. Ajay had appeared in a pan masala brand's commercial.

269.title: PM Modi can't imprison truth, MLA Mevani's arrest undemocratic: Rahul
269.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that the arrest of MLA Jignesh Mevani was "undemocratic" and "unconstitutional", adding that PM Narendra Modi can't imprison truth. "Modi ji, you can try to crush dissent by abusing the state machinery," he said. Congress leader KC Venugopal also termed Mevani's arrest as unconstitutional and alleged authoritarianism by the BJP.

270.title: Russian warship actually went & f***ed itself: Ukraine as Russia's top warship destroyed
270.article_body: Days after Russian warship 'Moskva' was destroyed after being hit by a Ukrainian Neptune anti-ship cruise missile, Ukraine said, "Russian warship actually went and f***ed itself as recommended." Ukrainian soldiers had told Moskva to "Go f**k yourself" in February. Ukraine also released pictures of postal stamps with the phrase on it that are up for auction.

271.title: If I were at MI, I would've given more overs to Tilak Varma: Harbhajan
271.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said MI haven't utilised Tilak Varma properly with the ball in the ongoing IPL season. "If I were there, I would've certainly bowled him more. He has good action for an off-spinner...he can bowl [during] middle overs," he added. Tilak, who has scored 183 runs in six games, has bowled only two overs so far.

272.title: Underground metro rail from Pune's Swargate to Katraj approved
272.article_body: The Maharashtra government has given permission for the implementation of the underground metro rail from Pune's Swargate to Katraj at an estimated cost of ₹3,668 crore. A final decision was awaited on whether to develop the route underground or elevated. The route will have three stations and the work will be completed by 2027.

273.title: Pic of UK Queen taken when she was aged 2 released on her 96th birthday
273.article_body: The UK Royal Family has shared a photo of Queen Elizabeth II as a toddler to mark her 96th birthday. The photo posted on Royal Family's Twitter handle shows a young Princess Elizabeth in 1928 - when she was two years old. "Then, in 1928, it was never expected she would be Queen," the post read.

274.title: 60-ft kachcha road collapses near mining lease area in J'khand, no one injured
274.article_body: A 60-feet 'kachcha' road collapsed near the temporarily closed mining lease area of Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) in Dhanbad district of Jharkhand on Thursday, the Deputy Commissioner said. No trapping or any death or injury has been reported till now or appears likely, he added. The officer further said that the incident took place at around 8:30 am.

275.title: People will go to watch a play but not films: Plabita Borthakur
275.article_body: Discussing the impact of OTT, actress Plabita Borthakur said, "People will go to watch a play but not films because they know that they will come on OTT soon." "[Due to]...COVID-19, everything has indeed moved to OTT and so have the stars," added Plabita. "Great stars might just surprise us with their acting on OTT," stated Plabita.

276.title: Mumbai Police helps 3-yr-old boy reunite with his family
276.article_body: A three-year-old boy, who was found near Phoenix Mall at VB Nagar, was reunited with his parents with the help of Mumbai Police. Tweeting the photo of their reunion, Mumbai Police wrote, "During interrogation, it was learnt that child resides in Sanjay Nagar Police Chowki jurisdiction." "His parents were traced by Ghatkopar Nirbhaya and reunited safely with them," they added.

277.title: Ponting said 'Either think we aren't prepared or show commitment': Axar
277.article_body: DC all-rounder Axar Patel said their head coach Ricky Ponting gave them two options after COVID-19 cases were reported from their camp ahead of their game against PBKS. "Ponting told us...'[Either] you can think...preparations aren't done. Or you can think outside things aren't in our hands and...show commitment'," revealed Axar. "We [focused] on our game...that was our mindset," he added.

278.title: Cong leaders visit Jahangirpuri to meet families affected by demolition
278.article_body: A group of Congress leaders visited Delhi's Jahangirpuri to meet the families affected by the demolition drive conducted by the MCD yesterday. The delegation will submit a report of the incident to party chief Sonia Gandhi, said Congress leader Imran Pratapgarhi. Former MLA Hari Shanker Gupta said the group wasn't there to disturb peace but only to meet the families.

279.title: 32 gardens named after civic officials' family members in Pune
279.article_body: At least 32 gardens in Pune have been named after family members and relatives of elected representatives, as per Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). According to a PMC mandate, gardens can only be named after national figures or those working in field of environment. This comes weeks after a BJP corporator renamed a garden in city's Salisbury Park after his father.

280.title: No average actor should work with Randeep Hooda: Shalin Bhanot
280.article_body: Sharing his experience while working with actor Randeep Hooda, actor Shalin Bhanot said, "It's a bad experience as one feels...you know a lot, but when you work with such talent you realise how much they prepare." "I felt [like] such an average actor in front of Randeep," added Shalin. "No average actor should work with Randeep," stated Shalin.

281.title: IIT grads-led B'luru edtech startup Newton School raises ₹190 crore
281.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Newton School has raised over ₹190 crore in a Series B funding round led by Steadview Capital. Existing investors Nexus Venture Partners and RTP Global also participated in the round. Newton School was founded by IIT Roorkee graduates Nishant Chandra and Siddharth Maheshwari. The startup raised over ₹36 crore in February last year.

282.title: Karnataka travellers fined ₹10,000 for travelling to Goa without permit
282.article_body: Tourists from Karnataka who were travelling to Goa without a special permit on the long weekend of Good Friday were fined ₹10,262. Around 40 taxis were stopped on their way to Goa and charged the penalty, as per Hindustan Times report. Drivers were reportedly not able to obtain the special permit as RTO offices were closed on the long weekend.

283.title: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba commander killed in encounter in J&K's Baramulla
283.article_body: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Yousuf Kantroo has been killed in an encounter in J&K's Baramulla district, police said on Thursday. He was involved in several killings of civilians and security personnel, including the recent killing of J&K's SPO and his brother and one soldier and one civilian in Budgam district, police said. Incriminating materials have also been recovered from his possession.

284.title: ED raids Jindal Steel offices in forex violation case: Reports
284.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate is conducting searches at Jindal Steel and Power Limited's (JSPL) offices in Delhi and Gurugram in connection with suspected violation of foreign exchange regulations, Moneycontrol reported citing CNBC TV18. JSPL's shares plunged as much as 6% to a three-week low in their biggest fall since mid-March. JSPL was India's fifth largest crude steel producer in 2021.

285.title: Putin hails 'liberation' of Mariupol as Russia claims control of city
285.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday hailed Russia's "liberation" of Mariupol after Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu told him that Moscow controls the Ukrainian port city apart from the Azovstal steel plant. Putin asked his troops not to storm the plant. Instead, he called for his forces to "block off this industrial area so that not even a fly can escape".

286.title: Actress Monalisa shares note for ailing mother, says 'Maa, you're a fighter'
286.article_body: 'Smart Jodi' contestant Monalisa took to Instagram to post some pictures with her mom and revealed that she had not been keeping well for the past one year. The actress wrote, "Last year had been a...tough year for her. She was doing rounds to the hospital and coming back home...Maa, you're a fighter...You gave us strength...This will also [pass]."

287.title: OTT helps actors who would've never got chances in regular films: Arjun
287.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal said OTT has helped in providing a medium to actors who would have "never" been given a chance to work in theatrical films. "It's given them a huge opportunity to showcase their work and tell stories you wouldn't usually see," added Arjun. Arjun stated that he does not listen to people and takes his own decisions.

288.title: One needs to have big heart to say sorry: Kapri on Akshay's Tobacco firm ad note
288.article_body: After actor Akshay Kumar issued statement, apologising for appearing in an advertisement for Vimal Elaichi, filmmaker Vinod Kapri took to Twitter to say, "Sorry is just a word but one needs to have a big heart to say it." Actress Juhi Chawla also reacted to Akshay's post and wrote, "Respect." YouTuber Maxtern wrote, "Love you sir."

289.title: Forest officials rescue endangered narrow-headed turtle
289.article_body: Indian Forest Service officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share video of a narrow-headed softshell turtle being rescued on Wednesday. The video shows officials taking the endangered animal in a vehicle to a water body where it is freed from the net and released into the water. They were lauded by Twitter users for their work.

290.title: Boy in Brazil born with 2 penises in 1-in-5 million defect, extra penis removed
290.article_body: A boy in Brazil was born with two penises in one-in-five million defect known as diphallia. Doctors at Federal University of Sao Paulo originally planned on removing the two-year-old boy's right penis, however, they surgically removed the left penis after his mother revealed he could only urinate from his right. The first known case of diphallia was recorded in 1609.

291.title: What I say doesn't matter: Abhishek on the things he learnt from Big B
291.article_body: Talking about the things he has learnt from dad and actor Amitabh Bachchan, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "What I say does not matter but what I do on screen matters immensely." Discussing 'The Kashmir Files', Abhishek stated that the film's success is very heartening for Bollywood. "It doesn't matter who is on the poster," added Abhishek.

292.title: Wheat stubble burning cases up 3 times from last year in Punjab: Data
292.article_body: Punjab has recorded 152 cases of wheat stubble burning, including 56 on a single day (April 20), so far in April, as per Punjab Pollution Control Board's data. The number is three times more than 2021 and 11 times more than 2020 for the corresponding period. Moga and Patiala districts reported the highest number of such incidents at 20 each.

293.title: Ankush Shinde appointed as new Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner
293.article_body: IPS officer Ankush Shinde has been appointed as the new Commissioner of Pimpri-Chinchwad Police. He will replace Krishna Prakash, who has been transferred to Mumbai as special inspector general of police (VIP security). Also, Sandeep Karnik has been appointed as the joint commissioner of police for Pune City and will succeed Dr Ravindra Shisve.

294.title: Decomposed body of 31-yr-old woman found in Bengaluru; husband held
294.article_body: The body of a 31-year-old woman was found in a decomposed state at her residence in Bengaluru on Wednesday night. The victim's husband, Ashok, has been arrested. The police were alerted after neighbours got a foul smell emanating from the house. As per the police, the accused had killed his wife on April 17 and then locked the house.

295.title: Boxer Amir Khan robbed of ₹72-lakh watch at gunpoint in London, CCTV footage surfaces
295.article_body: Boxer Amir Khan was robbed of a ₹72-lakh watch at gunpoint in London on Monday evening. A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing hooded thugs stopping Amir near his car. "In UK...the law is quite strong where hardly anyone, even the police, don't really carry guns. So, it was quite shocking to see a gun pointed at me," Amir said.

296.title: Consider working at Boring Company: Musk as his company raises $675 mn
296.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Please consider working at The Boring Company! Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth." Musk tweeted this after his company, which builds tunnels for vehicles to avoid traffic, raised $675 million in funding at a $5.675 billion valuation. "Purpose is to recruit amazing people," The Boring Company tweeted.

297.title: Mumbai Police couple raises ₹56 lakh to treat rare disease of son
297.article_body: A Mumbai Police couple has raised ₹56 lakh for the treatment of their four-year-old son suffering from a rare disease called Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA Type-III). The boy reportedly faced problems while crawling, sitting and walking amid the medical condition. According to the couple, industrialist Ratan Tata funded ₹49 lakh, while the rest of the amount was raised through crowdfunding.

298.title: Heavy vehicle owner issued e-challan grabs Mumbai constable by collar
298.article_body: The owner of two heavy vehicles grabbed head constable, Sharad Chaudhary, by his collar and manhandled him after he was issued an e-challan. Chaudhary and his colleague were identifying heavy vehicles to issue e-challans during peak hours when the owner of vehicles asked them not to issue a challan. While e-challan was issued to one vehicle, another managed to escape.

299.title: $54 billion wiped off Netflix's market value in its biggest drop since 2004
299.article_body: Netflix shares crashed 35% on Wednesday, wiping off $54 billion from the company's market value in its biggest drop since 2004. It made Netflix the worst-performing stock of the year on both S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes. Netflix shares crashed after it reported losing 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022, marking the first drop in subscribers in over 10 years.

300.title: Govt shares names of fastest growing major economies in world, India tops list
300.article_body: Government has shared the names of some of the fastest growing major world economies and said, "As India marches on a high-growth trajectory, the country is set to remain the fastest growing economy in the world." India tops list with 8.2% GDP growth projection by IMF. China has a growth projection of 4.4%, while US and UK are at 3.7%.

301.title: Shehnaaz visits her hometown in Punjab; shares video of riding on horse cart
301.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill shared a vlog to show a glimpse of how she spent a day in her village in Punjab. In the video, Shehnaaz is standing nearby a crop field, where she is seen clicking selfies with kids and treating them with ice-creams. She later took a horse cart ride to reach her house.

302.title: Glad they don't remember: Ayushmann on actors being rude to him
302.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said there were a "lot" of times when actors were "rude" to him while interviewing them in the past, adding he is glad they don't remember as it would have been "embarrassing" for them. "Most of the actors, they don't care sometimes," stated Ayushmann. Ayushmann recently completed 10 years in Bollywood with 'Vicky Donor' being his debut film.

303.title: BJP turned K'taka into corruption capital of country: Congress' Shivakumar
303.article_body: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that BJP-led state government has transformed Karnataka into "corruption capital of the country". He further claimed that the government had failed to bring justice to contractor Santosh Patil. "They are...protecting the accused (KS Eshwarappa)," he said. Shivakumar earlier demanded Eshwarappa's arrest in the alleged suicide of Santosh Patil.

304.title: Stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps: Kajal Aggarwal on struggles after giving birth
304.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, who recently gave birth to her son Neil, took to Instagram to pen a note. "Our birthing was exhilarating, overwhelming, long, yet the most satisfying experience there could be!" she wrote. "Of course it's not been easy- 3 sleepless nights, learning to latch and burp, squishy bellies and stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps," she added.

305.title: Rohit got exaggerated with his reactions vs LSG, that's not good: Hogg
305.article_body: Discussing MI's defeat against LSG, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "[MI captain] Rohit Sharma got exaggerated with his reactions when there was a dropped catch." "Rohit put his hands on the head and fell on the ground after an overthrow off Jasprit Bumrah's bowling," added Hogg. "That's not good when you are trying to establish a culture," stated Hogg.

306.title: Largest crypto exchange Binance limits services in Russia
306.article_body: World's largest crypto exchange Binance is limiting services for Russian nationals or entities that have crypto assets exceeding €10,000, following the EU's latest sanctions against Russia. Russian nationals or legal entities in Russia who have crypto account balances that exceed €10,000 will be given 90 days to close their positions. Affected accounts will be put into a withdrawal-only mode.

307.title: Nestle India's profit falls to ₹595 cr in Q1 2022 amid high inflation
307.article_body: Nestle India's profit in the January-March 2022 quarter fell marginally to ₹594.7 crore. "As highlighted in previous quarters, costs of key raw and packaging materials are witnessing 10-year highs and costs continued to surge this quarter which has impacted profit from operations," Nestle said. Its revenue rose 10.2% YoY to ₹3,980.7 crore while its operating margin fell 200 basis points.

308.title: They are not batting sensibly: Harbhajan on PBKS scoring 115 vs DC
308.article_body: Reacting to PBKS' defeat against DC by 9 wickets having been bowled out for 115, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said PBKS shouldn't forget the basics of the game. "Whenever you lose wickets, there needs to be a partnership through sensible batting which they aren't doing at the moment," added Harbhajan. "Net run rate (NRR) will definitely hurt them," stated Harbhajan.

309.title: 20-yr-old Chandigarh girl bags International Master title in chess
309.article_body: Tarini Goyal, a 20-year-old chess player from Chandigarh, bagged the International Master title at Budapest's Vezerkepzo International Master becoming India’s 43rd Woman International Master (WIM). This is Tarini’s third WIM norm. She won her first two mandatory norms at World Youth Chess Championship in Greece (2018) and Abu Dhabi (2019). “The third...title has come after much wait,” Tarini said.

310.title: Burglars trigger gelatin blast at ATM in Pimpri Chinchwad, fail to rob cash
310.article_body: In an attempt to rob an ATM kiosk in Pimpri Chinchwad, two people on Thursday morning allegedly triggered a blast with the help of gelatin sticks. However, "they couldn't break open the cash box", police said. "Some people, who...were alerted because of...blast, came to the spot and even tried to chase the burglars but they managed to flee," police added.

311.title: Best time to invest in India as govt committed to economic reforms: Anurag Thakur
311.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that it is the best time to invest in India as the central government is committed to carrying out deep economic reforms going forward. When the world was struggling, India was busy strengthening its foundation for the post-pandemic world, he added. During the pandemic, 47 unicorns were born in India, he further said.

312.title: US Capitol evacuated after parachute demonstration triggers false alarm
312.article_body: The US Capitol was briefly evacuated on Wednesday after police identified an aircraft as "a probable threat". Later, it was found that the plane was military aircraft carrying parachutists for a demonstration at a baseball stadium. Calling it an "outrageous mistake", House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the Federal Aviation Administration had failed to inform Capitol Police of the pre-planned flyover.

313.title: If Pollard is not bowling, then MI got to look at his scores: Manjrekar
313.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has questioned Kieron Pollard's place in MI's playing XI, stating that the team needs to look at his contribution if the 34-year-old is playing as a batter. "Pollard has to bowl at least three overs...if he's not bowling...[then] I think [MI] got to look at scores," stated Manjrekar. Pollard has scored 82 runs in six games.

314.title: EU panel backs proposal for common worldwide phone charger port
314.article_body: A European Parliament committee on Wednesday backed a proposal suggesting the adoption of a common charging port for a range of mobile gadgetry including phones, tablets, low-powered laptops and headphones. Chargers for portable devices shipped to Europe generate 11,000 to 13,000 tonnes of e-waste every year, a Parliamentarian said. An assembly vote over the proposal will take place next month.

315.title: Imran Khan govt fell due to strained ties with ‘establishment’: Ex-minister
315.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan-led government was ousted as its relations with the "establishment" were strained, said PTI leader and ex-minister Fawad Chaudhry. "Had our [relationship] with the establishment been good, we would have still been in the government," he said. This comes amid rumours of discord between Pakistan's army and the former government.

316.title: Wear masks in buses, cinema halls, schools, offices: Punjab govt as COVID cases rise
316.article_body: As COVID-19 cases rise in the country, the Punjab government has asked people to wear masks in crowded places. "Wearing of masks should be specially ensured in closed environments like buses, trains, taxis, cinema halls, shopping malls, departmental stores, schools, offices and indoor gatherings," the notice issued by the government read.

317.title: Man shot twice by fellow moviegoer during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening in Karnataka
317.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was shot twice by a fellow moviegoer during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening in Karnataka's Haveri district. The incident happened after a quarrel erupted between the two after the man reportedly kept his leg on the front seat on which the accused was sitting. The man was taken to a hospital, where he is currently recuperating.

318.title: Will be blessing if I can kick like you in few yrs: Tiger on Big B trying kicks
318.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff shared pictures of actor Amitabh Bachchan trying flexible kicks. "Sir if I still can kick like you even...few years later, it will be a blessing," Tiger wrote. "Seeing Tiger Shroff getting...'like' numbers through his flexible kick abilities...I thought I would also give it a try...in hope of getting...small percentage of 'likes'," Bachchan had written in a post.

319.title: US announces $48 million aid for Afghan refugees in Pakistan
319.article_body: The United States has announced an assistance package of over $48 million for Afghan refugees living in Pakistan. The aid is meant for "Afghan refugees and host communities" in Pakistan, said the US embassy in Pakistan. It added that following the latest aid, the total assistance the US has provided reached up to $262 million.

320.title: 8-yr-old black boy cries as he is detained for stealing in US; people call it 'traumatic'
320.article_body: After a video showing officers detaining an 8-year-old boy for apparently stealing a packet of chips sparked outrage, US' Syracuse Police Department said, "The incident is being reviewed." In the video, a man can be heard saying, "Why are you treating the boy like a cold-blooded criminal." People called the video which showed the child crying "traumatic".

321.title: NASA shares video of solar eclipse on Mars that lasted 40 secs
321.article_body: NASA has shared a video of a solar eclipse on Mars taken by its Perseverance rover that shows Mars' moon Phobos crossing the face of the Sun. The eclipse, captured on April 2, lasted a little over 40 seconds. Phobos, which is about 157 times smaller than Earth's moon, is one of Mars' two natural satellites.

322.title: Centre working on national database on internal security: Amit Shah
322.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said the Centre is working on a national database related to internal security covering terror funding, bomb blasts, narcotics, fake currency, hawala and terrorism. The database will help the central agencies and police in states and UTs in investigations, Shah added while speaking at the 13th National Investigation Agency (NIA) Day programme.

323.title: It was a tough one, a day to forget for us: Mayank on defeat vs DC
323.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said it was a day to forget for them as they lost by nine wickets against DC. "We didn't bat and bowl well, we just need to move on...We've been losing too many wickets too early, that's a concern," he added. PBKS are placed eighth on the points table after losing four of their seven games.

324.title: Tell Centre not to harass industrialists: Mamata to Guv Dhankhar
324.article_body: Addressing people during Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee urged Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar to tell the central government not to "harass" industrialists through central agencies. She also thanked Dhankhar for attending the event and said, "I am happy that the Governor joined me here. We appreciate your support. Please always keep doing so."

325.title: 32-year-old worker killed in blast at firecracker unit in Tamil Nadu
325.article_body: A 32-year-old man was killed in a blast at a firecracker unit in Tamil Nadu's Sivakasi on Wednesday. According to reports, S Aravindswamy was working inside the factory at the time of the blast and got trapped under debris. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin expressed condolences and announced a relief amount of ₹3 lakh for the deceased's family.

326.title: US judge rejects 'gag order' for Musk in 2018 Tesla tweets case
326.article_body: A US judge has ruled Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be subjected to a "gag order" in a lawsuit against his 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private. He said no proof was found that letting Musk talk posed a danger to a trial. Shareholders had asked for the order after Musk recently discussed the case at a TED conference.

327.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in Delhi's Dwarka, heroin worth ₹2.70 cr seized
327.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested a 29-year-old Nigerian drug peddler from Dwarka under operation 'Varchasva'. Police also seized high quality heroin worth ₹2.70 crore from his possession. "Based on a secret tip, a team was prepared under the leadership of ACP Vijay Singh and SI Subhas for the arrest of this foreign national," DCP Shankar Choudhary said.

328.title: UK Queen Elizabeth gets her own Barbie doll for Platinum Jubilee
328.article_body:
Britain's Queen Elizabeth II is being honoured with a Barbie doll to mark her Platinum Jubilee this year. Elizabeth, who turned 96 on Thursday, ascended the throne on February 6, 1952, after her father, King George VI's death. She's the longest-ruling monarch in British history.
The doll will be sold ahead of the official Platinum Jubilee celebrations in early June.

329.title: Stretched skin, frozen pads & breast pumps: Kajal on postpartum struggles
329.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal took to Instagram on Thursday to share a note about the birth of her son Neil. Speaking about her experience of becoming a mother and her postpartum struggles, Kajal wrote, "Elated to welcome my baby Neil into this world...of course, it's not been easy...Stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps...all topped with dozes of anxiety."

330.title: Mumbai's BEST to go digital; Aaditya Thackeray launches tap-in tap-out service
330.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray inaugurated tap-in tap-out service for Mumbai’s BEST (Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport) on Wednesday, making it city's first bus to go fully digital. “Inaugurated tap-in tap-out service on Gateway of India to Churchgate route...We’ll be implementing this in all 10 buses on this route...and expand it on all 438 routes,” Thackeray tweeted.

331.title: 3 men held for stalking & harassing 2 female college students in Punjab
331.article_body: Three men were arrested from Punjab’s Anandpur Sahib for stalking and harassing two female college students. While the girls were returning to their college on Sunday evening, the accused started following them in a car, police said. Two of them passed vulgar comments and threw ₹20 notes at the girls, prompting them to record the men on video, police added.

332.title: Bulldozer represents the arbitrary order: Congress' P Chidambaram
332.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said the bulldozer represents the "arbitrary order". His remark came in reaction to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area. "Once arbitrary orders override law, we are on the road to hell," Chidambaram tweeted. "The Supreme Court represents ‘law’. Yesterday, we saw the bulldozer defy the law. Let’s see what happens today," he added.

333.title: DC share video of David Warner screaming 'How's the josh?' in dressing room after win
333.article_body: DC took to Instagram to share a video of opener David Warner screaming 'How's the josh?' in the dressing room following their nine-wicket victory over Punjab Kings (PBKS). In the video, DC players can be heard responding to Warner with 'High sir!' after which Warner can be seen saluting. DC are currently sixth on the IPL 2022 points table.

334.title: How does Kohli's performance in first 7 matches of IPL 2022 compare with other seasons?
334.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli has scored 119 runs in the first seven matches of IPL 2022. It is the least amount of runs Kohli has got in the first seven matches of any IPL season. Kohli scored 122 runs in the first seven matches of inaugural IPL, while he scored 433 runs in the first seven matches of IPL 2016.

335.title: I was 2 when I 1st faced camera, never got to watch that video: Actress Wamiqa
335.article_body: Actress Wamiqa Gabbi said she first faced the camera when she was only two years old. "I first faced camera for shooting music video. However, I never got to watch that video as it is not available online or anywhere for that matter," she added. She further said she got involved in theatre and took part in plays in school.

336.title: Fraudster in police uniform video calls Mumbai man, cheats him of ₹3 lakh
336.article_body: A 26-year-old Mumbai man was allegedly cheated of ₹3 lakh after he received a video call from a gang of fraudsters in which one was wearing police uniform. As per the complainant, the fraudsters convinced him that his documents were misused by a criminal and he needed to register a case for which he will have to pay money.

337.title: K'taka Cong MLA slaps man who asked him to fix roads in village
337.article_body: Congress MLA from Pavagada, Venkataramanappa, slapped a person who asked him to fix roads and solve water problems in his village, Nagennahalli on Wednesday. A video of the incident, that took place near the tehsildar's office in Pavagada, went viral on social media. "This is how CONgress addresses the problems faced by Citizens," BJP Karnataka wrote on Twitter.

338.title: Whenever there are anti-terror ops, rights groups raise issue: Shah
338.article_body: Calling terrorism the biggest cause of human rights violations, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that the human rights groups raise issues whenever anti-terror operations are conducted. "It's imperative to eradicate terrorism from its roots to safeguard human rights," he added. Shah was speaking at the 13th National Investigation Agency (NIA) Day programme in Delhi.

339.title: We know how to get out of it: Bravo on CSK losing 5 of their 6 games
339.article_body: Talking about their five defeats in six games in the ongoing IPL season, CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo said they know "how to get out of it". "It can easily go haywire if it's a different franchise...teams get divided and there's outside pressure and noise. But with CSK there's none of that," he added. CSK are placed ninth on points table.

340.title: Mumbai woman says stranger added her as loan guarantor twice, police responds
340.article_body: A woman took to Twitter to share screenshot of a message, while also claiming she has been added as a loan guarantor twice by a person she does not know. "Even after informing him not to add...[he is] still doing the same...@MumbaiPolice @ThaneCityPolice...please take action against him," she wrote. Mumbai Police asked her to report issue at nearest police station.

341.title: Ministry of Home Affairs reshuffles 42 officers across AGMUT cadre
341.article_body: In a reshuffle of AGMUT (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and Union Territories) cadre officers, the Ministry of Home Affairs has transferred 42 officers to and from Delhi and other Union Territories. Among these are two DCPs who were heading the Special Investigation Teams set up to investigate Northeast Delhi riot cases.

342.title: 4 arrested for cheating finance company of ₹4.6 crore in Gujarat
342.article_body: Ahmedabad Police's DCB arrested four persons for allegedly cheating a finance company of ₹4.6 crore which they had sought to purchase land on behalf of unsuspecting customers. According to police, Parbat Rabari, owner of a builder company, Rishabh Yagnik, the then general manager at the loan finance company, Kalpesh Prajapati, a valuer and Dilip Shah, a broker were arrested.

343.title: Russian ICBM test 'routine' and 'not a threat', says US
343.article_body: Russia "properly" notified the US ahead of its test launch of the intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Pentagon said, adding the test was "routine" and "not a threat to the US or its allies". On Wednesday, Russia conducted a first test launch of its Sarmat ICBM. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the missile can hit any target on Earth.

344.title: Apple store workers in Atlanta file for firm's 1st US union election
344.article_body: Workers at an Apple store in Atlanta have filed for a union election with the NLRB. If a majority of the workers vote to unionise, the store would be the first unionised US Apple store. "We want to make sure...every Apple worker is able to afford quality housing and basic living expenses," an Apple worker said.

345.title: Lack of coordination among NDA led to BJP's defeat in Bochahan bypoll: JD(U) leader
345.article_body: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said that "lack of coordination among NDA partners" led to the recent defeat of BJP in Bochahan assembly seat by-election in Bihar. "The BJP's central leadership should intervene and consider the JD(U)'s long-standing demand for a coordination committee in Bihar," he added. RJD candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan election by margin of 36,617 votes.

346.title: Military hospitals, cantonments to get Ayurveda centres: Govt
346.article_body: The ministries of Defence and Ayush have agreed to set up Ayurveda centres at 12 military hospitals and 37 cantonments across the country. The centres will come up in Agra, Dalhousie, Jhansi, Jammu, Jalandhar and Delhi. The MoUs were signed during the Global Ayush Investment and Innovation Summit in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, which was attended by PM Narendra Modi.

347.title: Supreme Court halts Jahangirpuri demolition drive for 2 weeks
347.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed demolition drive in Jahangirpuri for two weeks, saying, "We will take a serious view of all demolitions that took place after the status quo order was communicated to the mayor." On Wednesday, the demolition, which started around 10.15 am, went on for two hours despite SC's directions at 11 am that status quo be maintained.

348.title: Fraudsters impersonate Tripura minister, ask for money on WhatsApp
348.article_body: Unknown fraudsters reportedly impersonated Tripura Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury and tried to con his contacts. The racketeers reportedly asked for money from his contacts, including several officials through WhatsApp messages.
