"The cyber-crime unit of the Tripura Police...is investigating the issue," a statement issued by Chowdhury's office said.

349.title: Video of woman giving birth in torchlight in Odisha goes viral, probe on
349.article_body: A probe was initiated after a video of a woman giving birth under the torchlight of a mobile phone due to power outage in Odisha's Ganjam district went viral. “Delivery could not have been delayed...I had to conduct the delivery under a cellphone torch as there was no generator or inverter facility available at the CHC," Dr Pragyan Prathama said.

350.title: Tripura govt announces health insurance scheme for journalists
350.article_body: Tripura government on Wednesday approved a health insurance scheme of ₹3 lakh for accredited journalists associated with print, web and electronic media organisations. According to Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury, journalists in the age group of 21-65 years will be considered eligible for the scheme. At present, Tripura has 177 accredited journalists, Chowdhury said.

351.title: It wasn't with Anurag Kashyap, speculation unethical: Mandana on 'secret relationship'
351.article_body: After revealing on 'Lock Upp' that she was in a secret relationship with a director following her split with husband, Mandana Karimi said that it wasn't with Anurag Kashyap as being speculated. "How can people play with names...It's not done. It's very unethical and unfortunate," she said. Mandana added that she and Anurag are friends.

352.title: When I'd try to leave, she'd scream 'I am going to die': Depp on ex-wife Amber Heard
352.article_body: While testifying in defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, actor Johnny Depp said, "Many times when I'd try to leave, she'd stop me, cry and scream." He added, "[She'd say] 'I can't live without you. I am going to die'." Depp added that Amber would follow him when he'd leave and scream in his parking lot.

353.title: UK PM tries his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat
353.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson tried his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat as he arrived in India for a two-day visit. "It is an immense privilege to come to the Ashram of this extraordinary man, and to understand how he mobilised such simple principles of truth and non-violence to change the world for the better," he wrote.

354.title: CSK, MI don't have top-order bowlers, that's why they're at the bottom: Ajay Jadeja
354.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said the lack of "top-order" bowlers has been one of the reasons why both CSK and MI are at the bottom of IPL points table. "CSK are not known for making many changes. An out-and-out fast bowler could have helped, but it's late now," he added. MI are winless in their six games in IPL 2022.

355.title: They threatened to enter my bedroom: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife on video of Sharif's supporters
355.article_body: Supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif threatened to enter the bedroom of Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith during a protest in London. Jemima shared a video on Twitter and wrote, "What is this protestor on the right outside my mother's house miming after threatening to enter my bedroom?"

356.title: Not sure how it got through review: Binance on its swastika-like emoji
356.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance took to Twitter to react to the issue surrounding an emoji it unveiled earlier, saying, "Well that was...really embarrassing. We're not sure how that emoji got through...layers of review without anyone noticing." Several users had pointed out the emoji's resemblance to swastika symbol used by Nazis. "We immediately flagged the issue, pulled it down," Binance added.

357.title: Woman gets calls seeking sexual favours as 3 men write number on K'taka toilet walls
357.article_body: A woman received over 500 calls seeking sexual favours after three of her colleagues scribbled her contact number and email address on the walls of public toilets and bus stands in many places in Karnataka. The accused had also sent obscene WhatsApp messages to the victim. A lecturer is among those arrested by the police.

358.title: I would like to do a comedy film with dad: Shraddha on Shakti Kapoor
358.article_body: Shraddha Kapoor said she wants to do a movie with her father-actor Shakti Kapoor and also added that she'd like to do a comedy film with him. She said, "He's constantly making us laugh in the house. It would be lovely to share screen space with him." Shraddha added that she is very inspired by her father and his work.

359.title: 23 of 105 parties eligible to encash electoral bonds: RTI response
359.article_body: Of the 105 political parties that submitted data regarding receiving electoral bonds to the ECI, 23 are eligible to receive and encash these, data shared under the RTI Act stated. In response to an RTI application, SBI said only 23 political parties have opened a special current account made for redeeming and encashing electoral bonds as of March this year.

360.title: Mathura temple shuts loudspeakers after UP govt order
360.article_body: Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi temple complex in UP's Mathura decided to switch off the loudspeakers after the state government issued directives on the use of sound systems at religious places. All 'bhajans' and 'kirtans' (prayers) will now be played at low levels so that the sound does not go beyond the complex, said a temple official.

361.title: Those criticising PM are premature babies born in 3rd month: Bhagyaraj
361.article_body: Actor Bhagyaraj called the people criticising Prime Minister Narendra Modi "premature babies born in the third month of pregnancy". "Why we should think that they were born in the third month is because...in fourth month...mouth is formed...and ear is formed...in fifth month. I call these people premature babies...because they will neither talk good nor listen to good things," he added.

362.title: I moved to Mumbai, thought 'why does everyone love SRK, why don't I': Shehnaaz
362.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said that when she moved to Mumbai, she wondered why everyone loves actor Shah Rukh Khan. "I wondered why don't I love him...I watched his films and then I became his fan," she said, adding that she used to live in her own world while she was in Punjab before moving to Mumbai.

363.title: Please consider working at Boring Company: Musk as it raises $675 mn
363.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to his startup The Boring Company raising $675 million at a valuation of nearly $6 billion, saying, "Please consider working at The Boring Company!" "Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth," he added. The startup's funding was led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital.

364.title: Owaisi has Jinnah's DNA, believes in Sharia law: Giriraj Singh
364.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for comparing Delhi's Jahangirpuri anti-encroachment drive with Turkman Gate incident during the Emergency and said that leaders like Owaisi view all issues through "Hindu versus Muslim angle". "They do so because they have Jinnah's DNA and believe in Sharia law, not the law of the land," Singh added.

365.title: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla inaugurates 4 India-Vietnam flights
365.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday inaugurated four new flights between India and Vietnam. These flights will help boost the economies of both the countries and increase business and tourism opportunities, Birla said. The new flights will operate between Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City and Mumbai as well as from Phu Quoc to New Delhi and Mumbai.

366.title: 6 people killed as plane crashes onto busy Haitian street
366.article_body: At least six people, including the pilot, have been killed after a small plane crashed onto a busy street in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on Wednesday, officials said. The plane had reportedly crashed due to an engine failure. Haitian PM Ariel Henry said he was saddened by the crash and offered his sympathies to the families of the victims.

367.title: Rohit Sharma is not going through a bad patch like Kohli: Manjrekar
367.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said that MI captain Rohit Sharma is "hitting good 20s and whenever he plays he looks in good touch". He added, "[Rohit's lack of runs] is not a bad patch like Virat Kohli's, who's not looking in good form. Rohit's machinery looks in top condition but then he gets out suddenly."

368.title: 2 owners of Gurugram guest house booked for using Ex-DCP's forged signature
368.article_body: Police have booked two owners of a guest house in Gurugram for using forged signature of former DCP-East Maqsood Ahmed in the facility's arrival-departure register. The matter came to light when  police personnel found Ahmed's signature on a certificate pasted on the first page of the register. On further investigation, the police found out the certificate to be fake.

369.title: Surprised that the no. 3 spot has been a rolling chair for LSG: Jaffer
369.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he is "surprised" to see that the number three position has been a "rolling chair" for LSG. "Sometimes Manish Pandey [bats] at that spot, Krishnappa Gowtham came against RR and Jason Holder was promoted to that spot as well," added Jaffer. "LSG have not used Ayush Badoni well in the last few matches," stated Jaffer.

370.title: Taiwan says 11 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone
370.article_body: Taiwan on Wednesday said that as many as 11 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. In response, Taiwan dispatched its air patrol forces, issued radio warnings and deployed air defence missile systems to monitor the activities of the intruding aircraft, said the country's defence ministry in a statement. The ministry also released a list of the aircraft.

371.title: My kids just want to know why I don't score a hundred: David Warner
371.article_body: On being asked what his kids tell him after he gets out, DC opener David Warner said, "They just want to know why I don't score a hundred." "They keep watching Jos Buttler score hundreds. They ask me, 'Why can't you hit the ball out of the park like him?'" Warner added. Warner has hit three consecutive fifties in IPL.

372.title: 4 US Amazon drivers sue firm over being stuck in warehouse amid tornado
372.article_body: Four US Amazon drivers have sued the firm after they sustained injuries while they were stuck in a warehouse amid a tornado in December. Amazon allegedly threatened to fire employees who tried to leave the facility and seek shelter at home. A separate lawsuit was filed on behalf of the mother of deceased worker DeAndre Morrow.

373.title: State-sponsored targeting of minorities: Rahul on Jahangirpuri demolition drive
373.article_body: Reacting to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that the act was a “state-sponsored targeting of poor and minorities”. "This is demolition of India’s constitutional values…BJP must bulldoze the hatred in their hearts instead," Gandhi added. Meanwhile, Congress’ Shashi Tharoor said that the demolition drive was "illegal".

374.title: Mango sticky rice sales sharply rise in Thailand as rapper eats it on stage in US
374.article_body: Thai rapper Milli's performance has led to a sharp rise in mango sticky rice sales in Thailand after she ate it on stage at California's Coachella festival. The 19-year-old rapper became the first Thai to perform solo at Coachella festival. Thai government said it may send a proposal for the rice to be listed as a UNESCO cultural heritage item.

375.title: 1 dead, 4 injured as electric scooter battery explodes in room in T'gana
375.article_body: An 80-year-old man died and four others were injured after an electric scooter battery exploded while being charged at their home in Telangana's Nizamabad, police said. The deceased and two others were sleeping in the room where the battery exploded, police added. A case was registered against a Hyderabad-based startup that had manufactured the scooter and the dealer, police stated.

376.title: Man sentenced to death for rape, murder of 7-yr-old girl in Bhiwandi
376.article_body: Thane Sessions Court on Wednesday sentenced a 30-year-old man to death for raping and killing a seven-year-old girl. The incident occurred in December 2019 when the accused, who was known to the deceased, kidnapped her and took her to a secluded place in Bhiwandi. He then raped the girl and smashed her head with a stone.

377.title: I'm enjoying my bowling after a long time and credit goes to Pant: Kuldeep
377.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season with 13 wickets in six games, has said he's enjoying his bowling after a long time. "The credit...goes to Rishabh Pant for the way he backs his spinners. This gives a lot of confidence...I've been given a lot of confidence in this IPL," he stated.

378.title: Mumbai woman tweets about neighbour molesting elder daughter, tags police
378.article_body: A Mumbai woman took to Twitter to say that her elder daughter was molested my her neighbour on March 28. "After spending more than 6 hours in Bandra Police Station, no FIR filed on my complaint...There after I gave...written complaint to DCP sir and ACP sir, till date no action," she wrote. She tagged Mumbai Police Commissioner in tweet.

379.title: 72 foreigners held for involvement in narcotics trade in HP from 2017-21: Police data
379.article_body: From 2017 to 2021, a total of 72 foreign nationals have been arrested for their involvement in the narcotics trade in Himachal Pradesh, according to state police data. During this period, half of the total foreign nationals arrested for involvement in illegal drugs smuggling in the state are from Nigeria, according to the data.

380.title: Used to be 90 kgs before my acting debut; I was very self-conscious: Sonia
380.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Broken But Beautiful 3', revealed she was overweight before making her acting debut and worked extremely hard to get in shape. She said, "I used to be 90 kgs and...[was] very self-conscious." "I worked on myself...took acting classes, got roles in off-broadway plays and became a full-time actress in New York first," she added.

381.title: 4 labourers kill co-worker, dump body in drain in Pune; arrested
381.article_body: Police arrested four labourers in Pune for allegedly killing their colleague and dumping his body in a drain in a gunny bag, with his limbs tied together. The men were reportedly drinking in a room when a fight broke out and the victim was beaten to death. Police arrested the accused on Tuesday after the body was found on Monday.

382.title: G20 members walk out of meeting over Russia’s participation
382.article_body: Several members walked out of a G20 meeting held in Washington DC over the participation of Russia against the backdrop of the Ukraine war. The representatives from the US, Ukraine, Britain, France and Canada boycotted the meeting when Russian officials started to speak. Many of the members attending the meeting virtually turned off their cameras.

383.title: Amazon, SpaceX, others bag $278.5 mn in NASA communications deal
383.article_body: Amazon's Project Kuiper, SpaceX's Starlink network and four others have won a combined $278.5 million in contracts from NASA to begin developing and demonstrating near-Earth space communication services that may support future missions. Kuiper won $67 million, while Starlink received $70 million. Each company is expected to complete the development and demonstrations of its satellites by 2025.

384.title: Accused in attempt to murder case gets bail in MP, asked to plant trees
384.article_body: An accused in an attempt to murder case was granted bail by Gwalior bench of Madhya Pradesh High Court on condition of planting 10 trees. The accused, who said he would do community service voluntarily, must produce pictures of the plants within 30 days and keep the court updated about their health for the next six months, the court said.

385.title: India now identified with minority persecution, Islamophobia: Tharoor
385.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor criticised Centre for carrying out anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and called the action "unconstitutional". "India's image is going downhill...Everything I hear from my friends abroad is deeply negative. We're being identified with minority persecution and Islamophobia," he said. "Government's job is to build up the nation, not bulldoze it down," he added.

386.title: Mother who flung baby girl out of hospital in Mumbai gets life term
386.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was given life imprisonment by a Mumbai court, nearly 12 years after she had flung her baby girl out of a window in KEM Hospital. A security guard, one of witnesses in the case, said that he heard a baby crying and on reaching the spot, he found that the infant's right ear was bleeding.

387.title: Retired colonel, wife found dead in Pune home, bore rifle wounds found
387.article_body: A 75-year-old retired colonel and his 63-year-old wife were found dead in their house in Pune's Mundhwa on Wednesday. Gunshot wounds were also found on their bodies. "The wounds are by a bore rifle...Prima facie it appears that the woman was killed by husband before he shot himself" said Namrata Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police, zone 5 of Pune police.

388.title: India is indebted to sacrifices of Sikh gurus: Amit Shah
388.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said that the country is indebted to the sacrifices of the Sikh gurus and it is due to their supreme sacrifice that we are a free country today. Shah participated in the celebration of the 400th Parkash Purab of Guru Tegh Bahadur at the Red Fort in Delhi yesterday.

389.title: Mamaearth announces OMG Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer
389.article_body: Mamaearth has announced its OMG (Oh My Goodness) Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer that's currently live on the Mamaearth app and website. Users can add two of their favourite skincare, haircare, and baby care products to the cart and get one product for free. To avail offer, use coupon code OMG at checkout.

390.title: Ex-national para swimming champ Amartya dies at 19, father says 'Nobody came for help'
390.article_body: Amartya Chakraborty, a three-time former national para swimming champion, passed away aged 19 at a hospital in Delhi. Amartya, who hailed from Salkia in West Bengal's Howrah district, had deformed fingers and suffered from multiple diseases. His father Amitosh said they sought financial help from Paralympic Committee of India and Sports Ministry for Amartya's treatment, but "nobody came for help".

391.title: After 1st film I was all over the place, wasn't easy to digest fame: Ayushmann
391.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that it was difficult for him to digest fame after his first film. "After my first film, I was all over the place...After six-seven months, I realised that you have to give time to your friends and family...I still try my best to strike that balance but it's difficult," he added.

392.title: There's a lot of out of the box thinking: Manjrekar on Pant's captaincy
392.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has praised DC captain Rishabh Pant's leadership after their nine-wicket win over PBKS. Manjrekar pointed out how Pant handled Shardul Thakur after the PBKS batters attacked him, scoring 20 runs off his first two overs, and introduced spinners to take wickets. Pant gave the ball to Lalit Yadav, who dismissed Shikhar Dhawan in the fourth over.

393.title: Bowlers did a fantastic job, made it easier for us: Warner after win vs PBKS
393.article_body: DC opener David Warner said their bowlers did a fantastic job, restricting PBKS to 115 runs. "[Our] bowlers made it easier for us...for me, it's about sticking to the basics and I tried to put my best footwork forward," he added. Warner remained unbeaten at 60 runs to help DC chase down the target in 10.3 overs.

394.title: 2 minor boys drown in pit while taking bath in Gurugram
394.article_body: Two minor boys, aged nine and ten, drowned to death in a pit on Tuesday while taking a bath in Gurugram's Bajghera village, police said. They were brought out by their family members and villagers, and were taken to a hospital but died, police added. One of the victims was a native of Assam and the other of Bihar.

395.title: Jharkhand leaders urge Guv to disqualify BJP MLA over caste certificate
395.article_body: A delegation of Congress, RJD and JMM leaders on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais seeking the disqualification of BJP MLA Sammari Lal over his caste certificate. "Since Sammari Lal is a resident of Rajasthan, he is not qualified to get his caste certificate made from Jharkhand," said the memorandum.

396.title: 11-yr-old boy survives landslide by hiding in fridge for 20 hours in Philippines
396.article_body: A Filipino boy survived a landslide by hiding in a refrigerator for 20 hours in what authorities are calling an "absolute miracle". The 11-year-old suffered a broken leg during the ordeal and was taken to a hospital. Authorities said that his mother and younger sibling are still missing, while his father died in another landslide.

397.title: Jersey director said, 'After seeing your dad's shot, nobody will look at you': Shahid
397.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said his film Jersey's director Gowtam Tinnanuri was worried that people will not notice his character in the film because of his father, Pankaj Kapur. "He said, 'After seeing your dad's take, you think anybody is going to look at you...He's so good, he'll pull all the audience, nobody will be interested in you'," Shahid added.

398.title: COVID-19 cases in India see 15% jump over yesterday as 2,380 people test positive
398.article_body: India reported 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,067 COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 13,433, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,062.

399.title: Nowadays sob stories on reality shows look fake; Boogie Woogie was real: Jaaved
399.article_body: When asked his opinion on reality shows today, actor Jaaved Jaaferi said, "All of them are looking the same. It (the sob stories) looks fake." He added that what made 'Boogie Woogie' stand out was the fact that everything that happened on the show "was organic, real, from the heart and not scripted". "Our reactions would come naturally," he said.

400.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company raises $675 mn at $6 bn valuation
400.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk-led The Boring Company has raised $675 million in a funding round led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital. The round has valued the startup at nearly $6 billion. The funding also saw participation from Valor Equity Partners, Founders Fund, 8VC, Craft Ventures, and DFJ Growth. The startup had last raised $120 million three years ago.
